title: Long-running Indigenous Marngrook AFL Footy Show axed from SBS after 12 years
text:
The Marngrook Footy Show has been axed after being on air for 12 years.

The Indigenous weekly AFL program, hosted by Grant Hansen, Gilbert McAdam, Leila Gurruwiwi and Shelley Ware, won't be returning to SBS next year.

On Monday, the show's founder and producer Grant Hansen took to his Facebook to confirm the news.

Over: The Marngrook Footy Show has been axed after being being on air for 12 years. Pictured are the show's hosts - Shelley Ware, Grant Hansen, Leila Gurruwiwi and Gilbert McAdam (left to right)

He wrote: 'It's true NITV – SBS has decided after 10 successful years and their most popular show not to continue with The Marngrook Footy Show.

'We are hopeful of continuing on another network. We thank all our fans and supporters for your support to the program over 12 years.'

Previously speaking to News Corp, Grant said he couldn't understand the reasoning behind the cancellation, as it was the most popular show on SBS.

Confirmed: On Monday, the show's founder and producer Grant Hansen took to his Facebook to confirm the news

'People are just stunned they were lining up to be on it,' he said.

'Musicians used to call us to get on the show, players and their managers would want to come on.'

The Marngrook Footy Show debuted as a Melbourne radio show in 1997, before going national the following year due to its growing popularity.

After 10 years, it was developed into a television show and shown on ABC and SBS.

The show went on to receive two Logie Award nominations for Most Popular Sports Program in 2015 and Best Sports Program in 2016.
description: The Marngrook Footy Show has been axed after being on air for 12 years.
authors: Ali Daher For Daily Mail Australia
